Can Indian Economy expect revival despite rising inflation? What do you think are the major steps that can be taken in present circumstances to push growth in the country? 

            India is one of the major developing countries in the world.After India has attained its independence in the year 1947,the Indian economy has been undergoing many drastic changes till today.There has been a tremendous development in the economy.

           Many economic policies have been introduced in the country in order to ensure the effective functioning of the economy.There have been many fluctuations in the way the economy has been functioning but the Government of India ensured efficiency in handling them by undertaking necessary steps. 

           "Inflation" refers to a sudden rise in the prices of products and services in the country.It is one of the major economic concerns faced by many countries today.Inflation has a great impact on the working of the economy.There are many factors which result in inflation such as scarce resources etc. India is more adversely affected by this problem when compared to other countries in the world.The latest example of inflation in our country would be the rise in the prices of petroleum.Inflation greatly affects the standard of living of common man in the country.

            The economic growth of a country depends upon the way in which the economy operates.Therefore,there is a need to protect the economy from problems such as inflation.Inflation can be controlled by taking certain preventive measures.The Goverment of India must ensure the availability of necessary resouces in the country.It must maintain healthy trade relations with other countries.It must take care of the economic environment prevailing in the country by having a periodical check on the various economic trends.It must also regulate the foreign trade i.e., the exports and imports.

             The Indian economy can definitely make a grand comeback in terms of economic growth inspite of the rising inflation,provided, it ensures the effective implementation of all its economic policies and takes necessary steps in controlling the rising inflation which hinders the economic growth of the country.
